Durability: Yes, tunable from durable to delayed durability to in-memory

Name: AntDB
Description: A scalable, multi-tenant, MPP-architectured,RDBMS,for OLTP and OLAP operations, highly compatible with,Oracle

Name: HGraphDB
Description: HGraphDB is a client layer for using,HBase,as a graph database by implementing the Tinkerpop 3 interfaces

Name: Fujitsu Enterprise Postgres
Description: Enterprise-grade,PostgreSQL,-based DBMS with security enhancements such as Transparent Data Encryption and Data Masking, plus high-availability and performance improvement features.
Developer: PostgreSQL Global Development Group, Fujitsu Australia Software Technology
APIs and other access methods: ADO.NET,JDBC,native C library,ODBC,streaming API for large objects
Partitioning methods: partitioning by range, list and by hash

Name: Badger
Description: An embeddable, persistent, simple and fast,Key-Value Store,, written purely in Go.

Name: DataFS
Description: All data is stored inside objects which are linked by so-called link attributes. Objects consist of classes which can be extended and de-extended at runtime. Graphs can be defined with a struct.
Data scheme: Classes, Structs, and Lists are written in proprietary DataTypeDefinitionLanguage (.dtdl) and Objects consisting of those are written in proprietary DataAccessDefinitionLanguage (.dadl)
Triggers: no, except callback-events from server when changes happened

Name: OushuDB
Description: A data warehouse powered by,Apache HAWQ,supporting descriptive analysis and advanced machine learning

Name: AgensGraph
Description: Multi-model database supporting relational and graph data models and built upon,PostgreSQL
Partitioning methods: no, but can be realized using table inheritance

Name: InfinityDB
Description: A Java embedded,Key-Value Store,which extends the Java Map interface
Server operating systems: All OS with a Java VM
APIs and other access methods: Access via java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentNavigableMap Interface,Proprietary API to InfinityDB ItemSpace (,boilerbay.com/docs/ItemSpaceDataStructures.htm,)

Name: Warp 10
Description: TimeSeries DBMS specialized on timestamped geo data based on,LevelDB,or,HBase

Name: Indica
License_info: parts of it are open source

Name: Newts
Description: Time Series DBMS based on,Cassandra
User concepts: no

Name: NSDb
Description: Scalable, High-performance,Time Series DBMS,designed for Real-time Analytics on top of Kubernetes

Name: PieCloudDB
Description: A cloud-native analytic database platform with new technologoy for elastic MPP
User concepts: User Roles and pluggable authentication with full SQL Standard

Name: searchxml
Description: DBMS for structured and unstructured content wrapped with an application server
User concepts: Domain, group and role-based access control at the document level and for application services

Name: SpaceTime
Description: SpaceTime is a spatio-temporal DBMS with a focus on performance.
SQL: A subset of ANSI SQL is implemented
User concepts: yes

Name: Tkrzw
Description: A concept of libraries, allowing an application program to store and query key-value pairs in a file. Successor of,Tokyo Cabinet,and,Kyoto Cabinet
User concepts: no

Name: Transwarp ArgoDB
Description: Distributed Analytical Database to replace Hadoop+MPP hybrid architecture

Name: Transwarp StellarDB
Description: A distributed graph DBMS built for enterprise-level graph applications

Name: Yaacomo
Description: OpenCL based in-memory,RDBMS,, designed for efficiently utilizing the hardware via parallel computing

Name: Yanza
Description: Time Series DBMS for IoT Applications
